config.display_name: McCain EBC - Manufacturing Quality, OEE, and Cost Optimization - Genie AI-BI
config.description: Genie space for mccain_ebc demo with curated questions and SQL instructions

instructions.title: Notes
instructions.content:
This Genie space supports near-real-time manufacturing monitoring and optimization across McCain plants and lines. It focuses on blend intake quality vs Product Specific Specifications (PSS), OSI PI end-of-line quality, OEE performance and downtime, and financial impact from over- and under-quality.

Use gold tables for fast answers to executive KPIs and anomaly detection:
- gold_line_hourly_quality: Hourly dry solids (proxy for dry matter), defect points, fry color shares, and flags for under/over quality using a 0.3pp tolerance on PSS min/max.
- gold_line_hourly_metrics: Daily aggregation of blend DM vs target and hours in breach by line/product.
- gold_quality_weekly: Weekly rollups by plant with hours_under_quality and hours_over_quality.
- gold_oee_kpis: Daily OEE KPIs per plant/line with performance proxy and downtime minutes.
- gold_cost_exposure: Daily cost estimates for over-quality waste and downgrade/rework exposure.
- gold_cumulative_costs: Cumulative raw spend and over-quality waste by region.
- gold_change_alignment: Hourly alignment of quality flags with downtime categories to correlate quality drift with maintenance/cleaning, including cutter-specific codes.

Business logic highlights:
- Under-quality if dry_solids_pct < min_dry_matter_pct - 0.3pp; over-quality if dry_solids_pct > max_dry_matter_pct + 0.3pp (per PSS tolerance).
- Over-quality cost waste uses regional cost curve: delta_DM * k_region * tons; under-quality exposure uses rework_factor_region * tons. EU-NL-P03 L2 SC-9mm shows sustained over-quality; NA-ID-P01 L3 CC-13mm shows under-quality aligned to cutter downtime (DOW-PI-4521, DOW-PI-4574).
- OEE performance dips around downtime clusters; weekends typically lower throughput.

Data quality considerations:
- Some demo tables have limited or placeholder dates (e.g., date sparsity in gold_cost_exposure and gold_cumulative_costs). Use weekly/daily aggregates for trend context.
- silver-level detail tables are available for root cause tracing (supplier loads, equipment inventories, raw OSI PI events). When detailed tracing is needed, cross-reference silver_oee_events and silver_line_quality_events_osipi.

Tip: Start with gold_line_hourly_quality to find deviation windows, use gold_change_alignment to correlate specific downtime categories, and quantify financial impacts via gold_cost_exposure. For scenario actions, consult gold_scenario_recommendations and silver_line_equipment to understand upgrade rationales.

While providing the output ignore <name>, </name>

instructions.title: Hourly quality deviations vs PSS by line
instructions.content:
-- Identify hours flagged under/over quality by plant/line/product
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       dry_solids_pct,
       min_dry_matter_pct, max_dry_matter_pct,
       under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_quality
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date, hour;

instructions.title: Daily blend intake DM vs target (aggregated)
instructions.content:
-- Daily average blend DM and hours in breach by plant/line
SELECT date, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       AVG(blend_dm_pct) AS avg_blend_dm_pct,
       SUM(hours_under_quality) AS hours_under_quality,
       SUM(hours_over_quality) AS hours_over_quality
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_metrics
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
GROUP BY date, plant_name, plant_line, product_name
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date;

instructions.title: Cost exposure (over-quality vs downgrade/rework)
instructions.content:
-- Daily cost exposure by plant/product
SELECT plant_name, region, product_name, date,
       tons_processed, avg_dry_matter_pct,
       over_quality_waste_usd, downgrade_rework_exposure_usd,
       raw_potato_spend_usd
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cost_exposure
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, product_name, date;

instructions.title: OEE daily KPIs and performance around deviations
instructions.content:
-- OEE KPIs per plant/line; joinable to quality dates
SELECT date, plant_name, plant_line, event_count, total_downtime_min,
       run_duration_min, qty_packed_kg, num_totes_on, oee_performance
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_oee_kpis
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, date;

instructions.title: Align downtime categories with quality flags
instructions.content:
-- Hourly alignment of quality flags to downtime categories
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       dry_solids_pct, under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag,
       downtime_cat_1, downtime_cat_2, duration_min, downtime_min
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_change_alignment
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date, hour;

instructions.title: Notes
instructions.content:
This Genie space supports near-real-time monitoring and optimization of potato processing quality and OEE for McCain Foods across NA and EU plants. Use gold tables for fast answers: daily line aggregates, cost exposure, OEE KPIs, cumulative spend/waste, and alignment of hourly quality flags to downtime. Blend intake dry solids percent (proxy for dry matter) and PSS thresholds classify under-/over-quality using a 0.3pp tolerance. Over-quality implies avoidable raw cost; under-quality increases defect-driven rework/downgrade risk.

Core business logic:
- Under-quality: blend DM below min_dry_matter_pct - tolerance; Over-quality: above max_dry_matter_pct + tolerance
- Cost exposure uses k_region coefficients for over_quality_waste_usd and rework_factor_region for downgrade_rework_exposure_usd
- OEE KPIs aggregate downtime minutes, run duration, quantity packed, and a performance proxy; weekends typically -10% throughput
- Downtime codes like cutter maintenance (e.g., DOW-PI-4521, DOW-PI-4574) align with NA-ID-P01 L3 under-quality during 2025-08-22..2025-09-05
- Scenario recommendations propose load reallocation and equipment upgrades with expected savings and quality delta

Data quality notes:
- Some date fields in cost exposure are demo-populated; rely on gold_date_spine for consistent bucketing when needed
- OSI PI hourly signals map dry_solids_pct to dry matter; slight differences vs load dry_matter_pct may exist
- OEE end_time parsing in silver had occasional format issues, handled in gold KPIs

Prefer gold tables for KPI questions and dashboards. Use silver tables only for deep dives when needed.

instructions.title: Daily Blend DM vs Target by Line and SKU
instructions.content:
-- Use gold_line_hourly_metrics for daily aggregates powering the DM vs target chart
SELECT date, plant_name, plant_line, product_name, blend_dm_pct, hours_under_quality, hours_over_quality, defect_points
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_metrics
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY date, plant_name, plant_line, product_name;

instructions.title: Cost Exposure: Over-Quality Waste and Downgrade/Rework
instructions.content:
-- Use gold_cost_exposure to quantify financial impacts by plant/product
SELECT plant_name, region, product_name, date, tons_processed, avg_dry_matter_pct,
       over_quality_waste_usd, downgrade_rework_exposure_usd, raw_potato_spend_usd
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cost_exposure
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY date, plant_name, product_name;

instructions.title: OEE KPIs Around Deviation Window
instructions.content:
-- Use gold_oee_kpis to analyze daily OEE metrics per plant line
SELECT date, plant_name, plant_line, total_downtime_min, run_duration_min,
       qty_packed_kg, num_totes_on, oee_performance
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_oee_kpis
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY date, plant_name, plant_line;

instructions.title: Correlate Hourly Quality Flags with Downtime Categories
instructions.content:
-- Join change alignment to see hourly under/over-quality against downtime categories
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name, dry_solids_pct,
       under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag, downtime_cat_1, downtime_cat_2,
       duration_min, downtime_min
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_change_alignment
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY date, hour, plant_name, plant_line;

instructions.title: Scenario Recommendations with Savings and Rationale
instructions.content:
-- Use gold_scenario_recommendations to surface actions for human-in-the-loop review
SELECT recommendation_id, type, plant_name, plant_line,
       expected_savings_usd, expected_quality_delta_pp, confidence, rationale
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_scenario_recommendations
ORDER BY expected_savings_usd DESC;

instructions.title: Notes
instructions.content:
This Genie space analyzes near-real-time manufacturing quality, OEE, and cost exposure for McCain Foods across NA and EU plants and lines. Use gold tables for fast KPI answers (hourly quality flags, OEE KPIs, cost exposure, cumulative spend/waste, and event alignment). Silver tables support supplier/load mix detail, raw OSI PI signals, downtime event logs, equipment inventory, and demand/revenue context.

Key business logic and context:
- Quality thresholds from PSS use a 0.3pp tolerance: under-quality when dry_solids_pct (DM proxy) < min_dry_matter_pct - 0.3pp; over-quality when > max_dry_matter_pct + 0.3pp.
- Event window: 2025-08-18..2025-09-12. Over-quality concentrated at EU-NL-P03 L2 (SC-9mm) due to high-DM Supplier S7 tranche starting 2025-08-17 and conservative blending. Under-quality on NA-ID-P01 L3 (CC-13mm) aligns with cutter maintenance deferment and downtime codes DOW-PI-4521/4574.
- Cost impacts: over_quality_waste_usd estimates incremental raw spend from DM above max; downgrade_rework_exposure_usd estimates expected rework/downgrade costs when DM below min.
- OEE performance dips and downtime components (cutter/fryer) correlate with quality drift via gold_change_alignment; use gold_oee_kpis for performance proxy and downtime minutes.
- Scenario Planner context: gold_scenario_recommendations surfaces load reallocation vs equipment upgrades with expected_savings_usd, expected_quality_delta_pp, and confidence. Use silver_line_equipment to interpret upgrade rationale (age vs rated TPH).

Data model notes:
- Blend/DM proxy: dry_solids_pct in gold_line_hourly_quality; daily aggregates in gold_line_hourly_metrics. Weekly plant-level view in gold_quality_weekly.
- Supplier/load mix: silver_potato_load_quality with dm_band and tons; join to silver_potato_variety_costs on region/variety/dm_band/effective_date for pricing context.
- Demand and revenue context: silver_product_revenue_by_line and silver_current_product_demand for margin and planning implications.

Data quality considerations:
- Minor naming inconsistencies for product_name between sources are standardized in silver/gold; prefer product_name and plant_line keys in joins.
- Some OEE end_time fields are missing in raw; gold_oee_kpis is already aggregated and reliable for KPIs, while silver_oee_events retains raw event granularity and codes.
- USDA fry color distributions are normalized as shares in silver_line_quality_events_osipi; defect points provide additional under-quality signal.

instructions.title: Find over-/under-quality windows by plant/line/SKU
instructions.content:
-- Identify hours flagged versus PSS thresholds with 0.3pp tolerance
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       dry_solids_pct,
       under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_quality
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date, hour;

instructions.title: Align quality flags to OEE downtime categories
instructions.content:
-- Correlate quality deviations with downtime components and durations
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag,
       downtime_cat_1, downtime_cat_2, downtime_min
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_change_alignment
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date, hour;

instructions.title: Daily cost exposure by plant and SKU
instructions.content:
-- Over-quality waste and downgrade/rework exposure
SELECT date, plant_name, region, product_name,
       tons_processed, avg_dry_matter_pct,
       raw_potato_spend_usd, over_quality_waste_usd, downgrade_rework_exposure_usd
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cost_exposure
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, product_name, date;

instructions.title: Cumulative spend and over-quality waste by region
instructions.content:
-- Executive cumulative view
SELECT date, region, cumulative_spend_usd, cumulative_over_quality_waste_usd
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cumulative_costs
ORDER BY date, region;

instructions.title: Throughput constraints and equipment context
instructions.content:
-- Identify equipment on constrained lines with effective rated TPH
SELECT le.plant_name, le.plant_line, le.equipment_id, le.equipment_type,
       le.equipment_rated_throughput_tph, le.effective_rated_throughput_tph,
       ek.oee_performance, ek.total_downtime_min
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_line_equipment le
JOIN mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_oee_kpis ek
  ON le.plant_name = ek.plant_name AND le.plant_line = ek.plant_line
WHERE ek.date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY le.plant_name, le.plant_line, le.equipment_type;

instructions.title: Notes
instructions.content:
This Genie space supports near-real-time detection and investigation of production quality deviations (under- and over-quality), alignment to OEE downtime patterns and equipment constraints, and quantification of financial exposure for McCain Foods plants and lines. Gold tables provide curated KPIs for hourly deviations, daily cost exposure, weekly aggregates, OEE performance, and change alignment; silver tables enable detailed slice-and-dice of raw loads, OSI PI quality signals, equipment inventory, demand and revenue context.

Core business logic and calculations:
- Under-/over-quality flags in gold_line_hourly_quality apply a 0.3pp DM tolerance relative to PSS: under if dry_solids_pct < min_dry_matter_pct - 0.3; over if dry_solids_pct > max_dry_matter_pct + 0.3.
- Cost exposure uses price per ton by region/variety/dm_band; over_quality_waste_usd approximates delta_DM × price_slope_region × tons; downgrade_rework_exposure_usd approximates shortfall × downgrade_loss_per_ton_region.
- Change alignment correlates hourly flags to downtime components (maintenance/cleaning/run) and specific cutter codes (e.g., DOW-PI-4521, DOW-PI-4574) on NA-ID-P01 L3.
- Weekly and daily aggregates highlight sustained over-quality at EU-NL-P03 L2 for SC-9mm and under-quality at NA-ID-P01 L3 for CC-13mm in the 2025-08-18..2025-09-12 window.
- Scenario recommendations include load reallocation and equipment upgrades; the table provides expected savings, quality delta, and confidence for human review.

Data model notes:
- Use gold_line_hourly_quality for hourly deviation analysis; gold_line_hourly_metrics for daily line-level trends.
- gold_cost_exposure and gold_cumulative_costs quantify spend and waste; silver_potato_variety_costs gives pricing context by dm_band and supplier/contract.
- gold_oee_kpis and gold_change_alignment expose performance and downtime alignment; silver_oee_events provides event-level details with component/code.
- silver_line_equipment lists equipment types, age, and effective rated throughput for upgrade assessments.
- silver_product_revenue_by_line adds revenue/margin context; silver_current_product_demand supports planning trade-offs.

Data quality considerations:
- Minor inconsistencies in product naming variants are standardized in silver/gold; rely on product_name in gold tables.
- End_time parsing in OEE silver may be missing in a subset; use duration_min/downtime_min fields for robust analysis.
- Some load-level variety labels are normalized; an 'Unknown' variety exists in small counts and should be excluded in strict compliance checks.

Recommended filters: date range (use the event window 2025-08-18..2025-09-12 for the demo), region (NA/EU), plant_name, plant_line, and product_name.

Use gold tables for fast answers; pivot to silver tables when tracing root cause across loads, events, or equipment.

instructions.title: Identify hourly deviations vs PSS with tolerance
instructions.content:
-- Hourly quality deviations by plant/line/product with flags
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       dry_solids_pct AS blend_dm_pct,
       min_dry_matter_pct, max_dry_matter_pct,
       under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_quality
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date, hour;

instructions.title: Cost exposure: over-quality waste and downgrade/rework risk
instructions.content:
-- Daily cost exposure metrics by plant/product
SELECT date, plant_name, region, product_name,
       tons_processed, avg_dry_matter_pct,
       raw_potato_spend_usd,
       over_quality_waste_usd,
       downgrade_rework_exposure_usd
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cost_exposure
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY date, plant_name, product_name;

instructions.title: Align deviations with OEE downtime components
instructions.content:
-- Correlate hourly quality flags with downtime categories/components
SELECT date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name,
       dry_solids_pct, under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag,
       downtime_cat_1, downtime_cat_2, duration_min, downtime_min
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_change_alignment
WHERE date BETWEEN '2025-08-18' AND '2025-09-12'
ORDER BY plant_name, plant_line, product_name, date, hour;

instructions.title: Weekly plant-level quality hotspots
instructions.content:
-- Weekly aggregates for defect points and breach hours
SELECT week_start, plant_name,
       avg_dry_solids_pct, avg_defect_points,
       hours_under_quality, hours_over_quality
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_quality_weekly
ORDER BY week_start, plant_name;

instructions.title: Supplier/load DM band shifts (pricing context)
instructions.content:
-- Load quality by DM band to see mix shifts; join to pricing if needed
SELECT l.arrival_date, l.region, l.plant_name, l.variety, l.dm_band,
       COUNT(*) AS loads, SUM(l.tons) AS total_tons,
       AVG(l.dry_matter_pct) AS avg_dm
FROM mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_potato_load_quality l
WHERE l.arrival_date BETWEEN '2025-08-10' AND '2025-09-20'
GROUP BY l.arrival_date, l.region, l.plant_name, l.variety, l.dm_band
ORDER BY l.arrival_date, l.region, l.plant_name, l.variety, l.dm_band;

tile.name: DBGEN_McCain_Manufacturing_Optimization_Assistant
tile.creator: brian.lui@databricks.com
tile.description: Assistant for McCain Foods demo that answers questions about equipment manuals, performance specs, and product quality specifications to support detection, cost impact, and scenario planning across plants and lines.
tile.instructions: You are a professional, concise assistant for the McCain multi-agent manufacturing optimization demo. Use the indexed PDFs to answer questions about equipment manuals (throughput, maintenance, error codes), PSS quality specs (targets, tolerances, downgrading protocols), and how these relate to line quality (blend DM, defects, fry color), OEE, and scenario planning. When asked for recommendations, ground responses in the manuals and specs, reference rated capacities (e.g., CUT-2000, FRY-XL), and align to PSS thresholds (e.g., DM targets and tolerances). Explain trade-offs between over-quality (excess DM cost) and under-quality (rework/downgrade risk). Be clear about assumptions if data is not in the PDFs and suggest checks with OSI PI/OEE logs as needed.

examples.question: How does raw potato dry matter influence cost per ton and what is the expected average quality?
guidelines: The answer should explain the approximate 21.5% average DM and describe the cost curve increasing above 21% dry matter, referencing the data in the document.

examples.question: How did the load quality distribution from supplier S7 change starting August 17, 2025?
guidelines: The answer should describe the shift to higher dry matter loads from S7, referencing the date and distribution change.

examples.question: What are the key considerations for reallocation of high-DM loads and equipment upgrades based on the scenario plan?
guidelines: The answer should identify feasibility factors, potential OEE improvements, and how to balance load quality with line capacity.

examples.question: How do you calculate the hourly blend dry matter and determine if it is under or over the specified target?
guidelines: The answer should mention the weighted sum of load DMs, the target thresholds, and the classification criteria.

examples.question: What are the dry matter target and defect thresholds for the SC-9mm SKU?
guidelines: The answer should mention the 21.8% dry matter target with a 0.3pp tolerance and defect rate thresholds as specified in the document.

examples.question: What is the rated throughput and maintenance procedure for the cutter at NA-ID-P01 L3?
guidelines: The answer should include the rated throughput value of 8.5 t/h and mention routine maintenance steps or error codes listed in the manual.

examples.question: What is the rated throughput and maintenance procedure for the cutter at NA-ID-P01 L3?
guidelines: The answer should include the rated throughput value of 8.5 t/h and mention routine maintenance steps or error codes listed in the manual.

examples.question: How do you calculate the hourly blend dry matter and determine if it is under or over the specified target?
guidelines: The answer should mention the weighted sum of load DMs, the target thresholds, and the classification criteria.

examples.question: How does raw potato dry matter influence cost per ton and what is the expected average quality?
guidelines: The answer should explain the approximate 21.5% average DM and describe the cost curve increasing above 21% dry matter, referencing the data in the document.

examples.question: How did the load quality distribution from supplier S7 change starting August 17, 2025?
guidelines: The answer should describe the shift to higher dry matter loads from S7, referencing the date and distribution change.

examples.question: What are the recommended troubleshooting steps for error codes DOW-PI-4521 and DOW-PI-4574?
guidelines: The answer should outline the troubleshooting process and maintenance actions related to the specific error codes.

examples.question: What are typical defect rates and fry color ranges considered acceptable at end-of-line?
guidelines: The answer should include the approximate defect rates of 1.4-2.2% and fry color median classes of 2-3, indicating acceptable ranges.

examples.question: What is the rated capacity and main maintenance considerations for the fryer at EU-NL-P03 P2?
guidelines: The answer should specify the 6.0 t/h capacity and refer to maintenance or error code information relevant to the fryer.

examples.question: What are the typical OEE performance ranges and how are downtime events classified?
guidelines: The answer should mention the performance thresholds, typical OEE values, and referencing specific downtime codes such as DOW-PI-4521.

examples.question: What are the typical OEE performance ranges and how are downtime events classified?
guidelines: The answer should mention the performance thresholds, typical OEE values, and referencing specific downtime codes such as DOW-PI-4521.

examples.question: What are typical defect rates and fry color ranges considered acceptable at end-of-line?
guidelines: The answer should include the approximate defect rates of 1.4-2.2% and fry color median classes of 2-3, indicating acceptable ranges.

examples.question: What are the dry matter target and defect thresholds for the SC-9mm SKU?
guidelines: The answer should mention the 21.8% dry matter target with a 0.3pp tolerance and defect rate thresholds as specified in the document.

examples.question: What are the key considerations for reallocation of high-DM loads and equipment upgrades based on the scenario plan?
guidelines: The answer should identify feasibility factors, potential OEE improvements, and how to balance load quality with line capacity.

examples.question: What are the recommended troubleshooting steps for error codes DOW-PI-4521 and DOW-PI-4574?
guidelines: The answer should outline the troubleshooting process and maintenance actions related to the specific error codes.

examples.question: What is the rated capacity and main maintenance considerations for the fryer at EU-NL-P03 P2?
guidelines: The answer should specify the 6.0 t/h capacity and refer to maintenance or error code information relevant to the fryer.

tile.name: DBGEN_McCain_Manufacturing_Optimization_Multi_Agent_Assistant
tile.creator: brian.lui@databricks.com
tile.description: Multi-agent assistant for McCain Foods demo that coordinates data exploration (Genie) and document Q&A (Knowledge Assistant) to detect under/over-quality production, quantify raw potato cost implications, align OEE/downtime patterns, and propose scenario plans (load reallocation and equipment upgrades) for the 2025-07-10..2025-10-31 window.
tile.instructions: Routing rules: Use Genie for any quantitative/data questions requiring SQL over the demo tables (silver/gold) including trends, aggregations, correlations, KPIs, and event alignment. Use KA for questions about equipment manuals, PSS quality thresholds, error code meanings, maintenance procedures, and operational protocols. For combined questions (e.g., data pattern plus policy/procedure guidance), invoke Genie first to retrieve metrics, then KA to provide the relevant policy/steps, and synthesize a concise answer. Be explicit about time windows (notably 2025-08-18..2025-09-12), entities (region, plant_name, plant_line, product_name), and KPIs (dry_solids_pct, hours_under/over_quality, over_quality_waste_usd, downgrade_rework_exposure_usd, oee_performance). Maintain an executive yet actionable tone focused on detection → impact → recommendation.

agents.name: Knowledge Assistant
agents.description:
Knowledge Assistant is the document Q&A agent with access to the following PDF collection(s):
- equipment_manuals_and_quality_specs (10 documents, ~6 pages each). Contents: line equipment manuals (cutter, fryer, washer, freezer, sorter) with rated throughput specs (e.g., CUT-2000 8.5 t/h, FRY-XL 6.0 t/h), efficiency thresholds, preventive maintenance steps, troubleshooting, and error codes (e.g., DOW-PI-45xx). Product Specific Specifications (PSS) documents for the last 6 months with SKU targets and tolerance bands (e.g., SC-9mm DM target 21.8% ±0.3pp), USDA fry color caps, defect point limits, and downgrading protocols.

What the KA can answer:
- Equipment details: rated/effective throughput, maintenance procedures, calibration steps, and troubleshooting for cutters/fryers; interpretation of error codes like DOW-PI-4521 and DOW-PI-4574.
- Quality specifications: definitions of min/max dry matter %, tolerance bands, USDA color class caps, defect limits, and downgrade/rework protocols for SKUs (SC-9mm, CC-13mm, WG-25mm) by plant/line.
- Procedures and policies: changeover/cleaning checklists impacting OEE, quality testing sampling methods, and actions when quality drifts above/below PSS thresholds.

Example question types for KA:
- “What is the DM target and tolerance for SC-9mm and how is over-quality defined?”
- “What maintenance steps are recommended when cutter throughput drops below rated capacity on L3?”
- “What does error code DOW-PI-4521 indicate and what is the standard response?”
- “What are the allowed USDA color mix caps for CC-13mm and the protocol when exceeded?”

KA does not access data tables; it strictly answers from the PDF collection listed above.

agents.name: Genie Data Explorer
agents.description:
Genie is the SQL/data exploration agent for the McCain demo. It can query the following Delta tables in catalog demo_generator, schema brian_lui_mccain_ebc. It supports aggregations, joins, filters, time-series rollups, and KPI calculations.

Available gold tables (exact names/columns):
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_quality: columns: datetime, date, hour, week_start, plant_id, plant_name, plant_line, product_name, variety, avg_length_mm, usda_color_0..4, total_defect_points, dry_solids_pct, fry_color_0_share..fry_color_4_share, min_dry_matter_pct, max_dry_matter_pct, under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag. Use to detect hourly under-/over-quality vs PSS thresholds (tolerance 0.3pp), compute breach counts, and trend blend DM vs target by plant/line/product.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_line_hourly_metrics: date, plant_name, plant_line, product_name, blend_dm_pct, defect_points, hours_under_quality, hours_over_quality. Daily aggregates powering line charts and breach-duration KPIs.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_quality_weekly: week_start, plant_name, avg_dry_solids_pct, avg_defect_points, fry_color_class_mode, hours_under_quality, hours_over_quality. Use for weekly plant-level comparisons and grouped bar charts.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_oee_kpis: date, plant_name, plant_line, event_count, total_downtime_min, run_duration_min, qty_packed_kg, num_totes_on, oee_performance. Use to analyze OEE components and performance dips around events.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_change_alignment: date, hour, plant_name, plant_line, product_name, dry_solids_pct, under_quality_flag, over_quality_flag, downtime_cat_1, downtime_cat_2, duration_min, downtime_min. Use to correlate quality deviations with OEE events by time/line.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cost_exposure: date, plant_name, region, product_name, tons_processed, avg_dry_matter_pct, raw_potato_spend_usd, over_quality_waste_usd, downgrade_rework_exposure_usd. Use to quantify financial impacts by day/plant/product and compute trailing-30-day counters.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_cumulative_costs: date, region, cumulative_spend_usd, cumulative_over_quality_waste_usd, cumulative_gross_margin_usd. Use to plot cumulative spend vs waste by region and optionally margin context.
- KPI counters: mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_counter_total_tons_last_30d (total_tons_last_30d), gold_counter_raw_potato_spend_last_30d (raw_potato_spend_last_30d_usd), gold_counter_oee_performance_avg_last_7d (oee_performance_avg_last_7d), gold_counter_downgrade_rework_last_30d (downgrade_rework_exposure_last_30d_usd).
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_date_spine: date, dow, is_weekend, week_start for joins and filtering.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.gold_scenario_recommendations: recommendation_id, type, plant_name, plant_line, expected_savings_usd, expected_quality_delta_pp, confidence, rationale. Use to surface proposed actions for human review.

Available silver tables (exact names/columns):
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_line_quality_events_osipi: datetime, date, hour, week_start, plant_id, plant_name, plant_line, product_name, variety, avg_length_mm, usda_color_0..4, total_defect_points, dry_solids_pct, fry_color_0_share..fry_color_4_share. Primary hourly quality signal source.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_oee_production_runs_and_downtime_events: datetime, date, week_start, plant_id, plant_name, plant_line, downtime_cat_1, downtime_cat_2, product_name, start_time, end_time_ts, duration_min, downtime_min, qty_packed, num_totes_on. Use for run/downtime alignment and OEE derivations.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_potato_load_quality: plant_id, plant_name, region, variety, dm_band, load_number, arrival_date, tons, average_length_grading_mm, usda_color_0_share..usda_color_4_share, total_defect_points, dry_matter_pct. Use to analyze supplier/variety quality mix shifts and correlate to line intake.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_potato_variety_costs: effective_date, region, supplier_id, variety, dm_band, price_usd_per_ton, contract_id. Use to compute blended cost curves and identify dated contract tranche changes (e.g., S7 on 2025-08-17).
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_product_revenue_by_line: date, region, plant_id, plant_name, plant_line, product_id, product_name, units_packed_kg, net_sales_usd, channel, tier, price_per_kg. For revenue/margin context by line/SKU.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_product_specifications_pss: plant_id, plant_name, plant_line, product_id, product_name, average_length_grading_mm_min/target/max, pct_min_50mm_length, pct_min_75mm_length, max_usda_color_0_pct..4_pct, max_defect_points, min_dry_matter_pct, max_dry_matter_pct, approved_potato_varieties. Reference for PSS targets and thresholds.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_line_equipment: plant_id, plant_name, plant_line, equipment_id, equipment_type, equipment_description, equipment_rated_throughput_tph, commission_date, equipment_age_years, effective_rated_throughput_tph. For equipment inventory and throughput constraints.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_current_product_demand: date, region, channel, product_id_raw, product_name_raw, orders_kg, forecast_kg, promo_flag, product_id, product_name. For demand alignment.
- mccain_ebc_catalog.ag_mfg.silver_oee_events: event_id, plant_name, plant_line, event_time, duration_min, downtime_min, component, code, notes. For listing downtime codes (e.g., DOW-PI-4521, DOW-PI-4574).

Genie-supported KPIs and calculations:
- Under-/over-quality detection: compare dry_solids_pct vs min_dry_matter_pct/max_dry_matter_pct with 0.3pp tolerance; compute hours_under_quality/hours_over_quality and magnitude (pp) by line/date.
- Financial exposure: aggregate raw_potato_spend_usd, over_quality_waste_usd, downgrade_rework_exposure_usd by plant/line/product/date; compute windowed sums (e.g., 2025-08-18..2025-09-12) and trailing counters.
- OEE analysis: trend oee_performance and correlate with total_downtime_min; join gold_change_alignment to see downtime_cat_1/2 around deviations.
- Supplier/variety mix: analyze silver_potato_load_quality and silver_potato_variety_costs by region/supplier/variety/dm_band, and align to plant/date to explain DM shifts.
- Scenario insights: read gold_scenario_recommendations to list expected_savings_usd and rationale by type {load_reallocation, equipment_upgrade}.

Typical questions Genie can answer:
- When did EU-NL-P03 L2 SC-9mm exceed max_dry_matter_pct and by how many pp relative to tolerance? Show daily blend_dm_pct vs target during 2025-08-18..2025-09-12.
- Quantify over_quality_waste_usd for EU-NL-P03 during the event window and compare to NA-ID-P01 L3 downgrade_rework_exposure_usd.
- List NA-ID-P01 L3 downtime codes and durations (from silver_oee_events) around 2025-08-22 and show oee_performance trend.
- Did supplier S7 price or dm_band mix change on 2025-08-17 in EU region, and how did avg dry_matter_pct of loads shift at EU-NL-P03?
- What cumulative_spend_usd vs cumulative_over_quality_waste_usd is observed in EU vs NA by date?

Time coverage: 2025-07-10..2025-10-31. Regions: NA, EU. Plants include NA-ID-P01, EU-NL-P03, etc. Lines L1..L6. SKUs include SC-9mm, CC-13mm, WG-25mm.

examples.question: Show cumulative_spend_usd and cumulative_over_quality_waste_usd by region from 2025-07-10 to 2025-10-31, highlighting the EU contribution.
During 2025-08-18 to 2025-09-12, which lines had the highest hours_over_quality and hours_under_quality, and what were their average blend_dm_pct vs PSS targets?
Did the supplier/variety mix and dm_band for EU region shift starting 2025-08-17, and how did the average dry_matter_pct of loads arriving at EU-NL-P03 change?
List all downtime events and codes for NA-ID-P01 L3 between 2025-08-22 and 2025-09-05 and show the associated oee_performance trend by day.
Which scenario recommendations have the highest expected_savings_usd, and what are their rationales (load_reallocation vs equipment_upgrade)?
For NA-ID-P01 L3, how did total_downtime_min and defect_points move week-over-week during 2025-08-18..2025-09-12, and what does the PSS recommend when defect limits are exceeded?
How much over_quality_waste_usd accrued at EU-NL-P03 for SC-9mm compared to downgrade_rework_exposure_usd at NA-ID-P01 L3 over the same window?
If we reallocate high-DM loads intra-region, what equipment rated throughput constraints (from manuals) should we consider for cutters and fryers?
What is the DM target and ±0.3pp tolerance for SC-9mm in the PSS, and how is over-quality vs under-quality classified?
What does error code DOW-PI-4521 mean in the equipment manuals, and what maintenance steps are recommended to restore cutter throughput?

manufacturing_quality_oee_cost.title: Production Quality, OEE, and Cost Exposure
